name: produce
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to make something or bring something into existence

example.eg: France produces a great deal of wine for export.
example.egtrans: 法国生产大量葡萄酒供出口。

example.eg: Red blood cells are produced in the bone marrow.
She works for a company that produces (= makes for sale) electrical goods.
example.egtrans: 她在一家生产电子产品的公司工作。

example.eg: I was wondering whether I could produce a meal out of what's left in the fridge.
example.egtrans: 我不知道能否用冰箱里剩的东西做一顿饭。

example.eg: She's asked me to produce a report on the state of the project.
example.egtrans: 她要求我就这项工程的状况写一份报告。

trans_examp.trans_en: When animals produce young, they give birth to them.

example.eg: Our cat produced four kittens during the course of the night.
example.egtrans: 我们的猫在夜里生了4只小猫。

example.eg: All our friends seem to be busy producing offspring at the moment.
example.egtrans: 我们所有的朋友现在似乎都忙着生儿育女。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to cause a reaction or result

example.eg: The senator's speech produced an angry response from the opposition.
example.egtrans: 参议员的发言招致了反对派愤怒的抨击。

example.eg: Her remarks produced an awkward silence.
example.egtrans: 她的讲话引起了一阵尴尬的沉默。

example.eg: If used on delicate skin, this cream may produce a stinging sensation.
example.egtrans: 这种药膏用在娇嫩的皮肤上会产生刺痛感。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to organize the practical and financial matters relating to the preparation of a film, play, or television or radio programme
to be in charge of making a musical recording and to be responsible for the arrangement of the music, the combination of the different instruments or voices and the general sound of it

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to bring something out from somewhere and show it

example.eg: He produced a letter from his desk that he asked me to read.
example.egtrans: 他从书桌里拿出一封信让我读。

example.eg: One of the men suddenly produced a knife from his pocket.
example.egtrans: 其中一名男子突然从口袋里掏出一把刀。

dsense.name: produce
dsense.posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to result in or discover something, especially proof

example.eg: A lengthy police investigation failed to produce any evidence on which the suspect could be convicted.
example.egtrans: 警方的长期调查并未发现任何能证明疑犯有罪的证据。

name: produce
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: food or any other substance or material that is grown or obtained through farming
trans_examp.trans_cn: （尤指大量生产的）食品，农产品

example.egtrans: 农产品／乳产品／新鲜的农产品
